citation.title: Orthostatic intolerance and tachycardia associated with norepinephrine-transporter deficiency.

comment.text: Amine transporter. Terminates the action of noradrenaline by its high affinity sodium-dependent reuptake into presynaptic terminals.

disease.name: Orthostatic intolerance
disease.description: Syndrome characterized by lightheadedness, fatigue, altered mentation and syncope. It is associated with postural tachycardia. Plasma norepinephrine concentration is abnormally high.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
This protein is the target of psychomotor stimulants such as amphetamines or cocaine.
Belongs to the sodium:neurotransmitter symporter (SNF) (TC 2.A.22) family. SLC6A2 subfamily.

feature.description: In OI; loss of function; dbSNP:rs121918126.
